entries.title: Hillary Clinton said that she had no knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein’s wrongdoing and accused House Republicans of conducting a ‘fishing expedition’ as she sat for a closed-door, videotaped deposition
A federal judge in Washington, D.C., on Thursday declined to block construction of President Trump’s planned White House ballroom
New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani and President Trump are set to meet Thursday in Washington in an unannounced meeting
Near misses in Operation Rough Rider, the U.S. military operation that targeted Houthi rebels in Yemen last year, are a warning about the risks of using military force against even a small adversary
The U.S. has sent top-of-the-line jet fighters to Israel, the first time it has deployed combat aircraft to that country for a potential wartime mission as they prepare to square off against Iran
Oil lobbyists have made the case to Trump officials in recent weeks that his attacks on wind farms off the U.S. coast risk derailing congressional efforts to speed up permitting for energy projects
The Trump administration is pausing nearly $260 million in Medicaid funding to Minnesota as a way to push the state to better account for how government funds are being distributed
Here’s a look at whether the math works on some of the economic proposals that President Trump made in his State of Union speech
Spy agency blocks Congress from seeing Gabbard whistleblower intel, Summers resigns from Harvard over Epstein links and 6-year-olds get their own makeup. Read more in today’s What’s News newsletter.
President Trump has ratcheted up pressure on Senate Majority Leader John Thune to find a way to pass the SAVE America Act
Casey Means, President Trump’s surgeon-general nominee, said during her confirmation hearing she believes vaccines save lives but declined to promise recommending measles and flu shots for children
James Talarico, running for the U.S. Senate in Texas, is stirring national fascination as he tests whether progressivism wrapped in a faith-based message can excite Democrats
With the midterm elections approaching fast, advisers want the president to stay on topics like the cost of living. But foreign affairs keep capturing his attention
The top Republican challenger to Rep. Tony Gonzales called for him to drop out of the primary race in Texas following allegations that he engaged in an extramarital affair with an aide
The Republican-led House passed legislation that would tighten federal voter registration requirements, advancing one of the party’s longstanding election priorities over the objections of Democrats
Unsealed document shows role Kurt Olsen, hired by the White House to investigation election fraud claims, played in spurring search of Georgia office.
Citing presidential claims of executive privilege, the Trump administration says it won’t share with lawmakers the classified intelligence that led to a whistleblower complaint against Tulsi Gabbard
The Pentagon is raising concerns to Trump about an extended military campaign against Iran, with Gen. Dan Caine, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff among those voicing warnings
U.S. officials say the Pentagon hasn’t received any orders to deploy Navy vessels to Greenland, despite President Trump’s social-media post about a hospital ship “on its way”
A man was shot and killed Sunday after breaching the secure perimeter at President Trump’s Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida, the Secret Service said
President Trump said he plans to send a hospital ship to Greenland as part of his continuing effort to exercise control of the island in the Arctic
